column4: I have a server with ssh access to it. I recently made a buddy of mine an account on the server and am going to hook him up with an rsa key for logon via winscp. he is running windows. Do I need to put an antivirus on the server to scan the files so that he doesn't get a virus?
the server also act as file server?
depending on your need, it could be needed...or not...
well, the point is for the two of us to share and store files on it. I am just using ssh to be secure.
yes I guess....basically a file server. on my LAN it also streams media to my PS3.
if you don't mind with extra I/O everytime a file is accessed...then go ahead
